item.title: Spring 2025 School of Engineering Midterm Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Friday, February 28, 2025 - Spring 2025 School of Engineering (SoE) Midterm course evaluations are now open. Your feedback is very important to the Institute and the school, so please complete the SoE midterm evaluation surveys for all your courses! Evaluations will be available through Monday, March 10, 2025.

item.title: COMM+D Offering Free Research Poster Design Workshop
item.description: The Center for Communication+Design (COMM+D) is offering a FREE workshop on designing research posters. Learn guidelines and strategies from experts will make your poster stand out. Bring your posters to be reviewed. Join us March 19 at 4pm in Sage 4711.

item.title: Purchase Your Bachelor and Master Regalia Now!
item.description: The Rensselaer Collegiate Store advises all Bachelor and Master candidates who will be participating in the May 2025 Commencement ceremony to place their order for regalia today. Bachelor and Master graduates can only purchase regalia from our website at rensselaerstore.com/graduation and are advised to do so before Friday, March 7, 2025.

item.title: Optional Practical Training (OPT) Info Session - Tuesday March 11th
item.description: Tuesday, March 11, 2025 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM. Are you an F-1 student graduating in May 2025 and want to work in the U.S. after graduation? Optional Practical Training (OPT) might be the path for you! Students must finish the OPT Workshop for foundational knowledge before registering for OPT Info Sessions. This is the final Spring 2025 OPT Info Session. Registration is required to attend the session.

item.title: Navy Civil Engineer Corps Officer Seminar
item.description: Friday, February 28, 2025 12:15 PM - 1:15 PM - Engineers and Architects – are you interested in serving your country in the U.S. Navy Civil Engineer Corps? Learn how you can be a SeaBee and practice expeditionary project management, design, planning, contracting, and more! Salary and other benefits are available to undergraduates. Join us in DCC 318.

item.title: Staying Healthy This Spring Semester
item.description: With winter virus season upon us, it’s important that we all take steps to protect our health and minimize the spread of illness on campus. Influenza has been peaking since January, both in New York State and on our campus. Simple preventive measures can make a big difference in keeping our community safe and well. Learn more about how to keep yourself and others healthy!

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: “Listening in a Hectic World”
item.description:
Tuesday, March 4, 2025 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Listening is a vehicle to get the information needed to accomplish work objectives. In today’s information-saturated work environment, everyone needs to be able to tune out the “noise” and tune in to what’s important. In this seminar, we explore a listening approach that balances the demands of getting the information that you need with the awareness that every interaction provides an opportunity to cement solid work relationships with others.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
